intro: Senecio glaucophyllus subsp. discoideus, commonly known as the silverleaf groundsel, is a member of the Asteraceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing, mat-forming plant characterized by its silvery-gray, woolly leaves that reflect light and reduce water loss. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
